statement:
Let $R$ be a subring of the field $K$, $1\in R$. An element $\alpha$ of
the field is integral over $R$ if and only if all $\varphi$ of $K$
satisfy the implication
$$\varphi \mathrm{\,\,is\,finite\,in\,}R\,\,\,\Rightarrow
          \,\,\varphi(\alpha)\mathrm{\,is\,finite}.$$

**1.** Let $R$ be a subring of the field $K$, $1\in R$. The integral
closure of $R$ in $K$ is the intersection of all valuation domains in
$K$ which contain the ring $R$. The integral closure is integrally
closed in the field $K$.

**2.** Every valuation domain is integrally closed in its field of
fractions.
